title: Job workers can take a while to respond and die

However, when we have lots of jobs finishing at the same time, there are times that the workers get busy and do not reply, and all these should take micro-seconds. The question is, which are these occasions that they take longer?

title: Roundtripping sequencing files does not work
body:
Steps to reproduce:
Download raw sequencing files (fastq), metadata, and prep info from study 1
Delete irrelevant samples/samples not of interest from metadata and prep info file
Create study 2
Upload revised metadata, prep info, and unchanged fastq files
Create new prep and associate fastq files
Attempt to demux fastq files
Receive error that demux-ing is not possible

I suspect Qiita expects fastqz and these files are fastq, though if that is the case we should make it accept both, document well that it wants fastqz and not fastq, and/or make the download buttons download .fastqz instead of .fastq

To be fair this current example at the top is only currently necessary (may in fact discourage later for data duplication reasons), because it is not possible to filter samples without losing taxonomy in the current Q2/Q2 plugin.

title: BUG: qiita_db.software.Parameters equality

milestone.title: November 1st, 2017
milestone.description:
Schedule:

Code Freeze: Monday October 23rd 9AM
PR merged: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate deployment: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate testing deadline: Friday October 27th 3PM
Main system deployment: Wednesday November 1st 7AM

body:
In working with the redbiom loading mechanisms, we discovered that trim length is in some studies an integer, and in some studies a string. That type difference presents downstream issues for redbiom as we distinguish contexts by the hash of the processing parameters and `150 != u"150"`. That can be worked around, however, this type difference is indicative of a bug within `qiita_db` when assessing the [equality](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/5b54aa7e445dd38b34373d9aa72481ffa7d214a4/qiita_db/software.py#L1318-L1337) of two `Parameters` instances. See below for an example of the type difference observed between two studies:

```python
In [16]: for a in qiita_db.study.Study(850).artifacts():
    ...:     if a.processing_parameters is not None and 'length' in a.processing_parameters.values:
    ...:         print(a.processing_parameters.values)
    ...:
{'input_data': 171, 'length': 100}
{'input_data': 171, 'length': 90}

In [17]: for a in qiita_db.study.Study(11360).artifacts():
    ...:     if a.processing_parameters is not None and 'length' in a.processing_parameters.values:
    ...:         print(a.processing_parameters.values)
    ...:
{'input_data': u'34913', 'length': u'150'}
{'input_data': u'35044', 'length': u'150'}
```

title: Connection error triggers stochastic build failures
body:
In some situations the Travis build will fail with a rather obscure error (the full traceback is shown below):

```
Error: error with status PGRES_TUPLES_OK and no message from the libpq
```

After some googling @antgonza came across this [issue](https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg2/issues/281) in the psycopg2 tracker, which points to a connection problem and is not necessarily a problem with psycopg2 (as per the maintainer's description). We noticed that this error would always be raised by [this function](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/master/qiita_core/testing.py#L51).

```python
def wait_for_processing_job(job_id):
    """Waits until a processing job is completed
 
    Parameters
    ----------
    job_id : str
        Job id
    """
    job = ProcessingJob(job_id)
    while job.status not in ('success', 'error'):
       sleep(0.05)
    sleep(0.5)
```

We speculate that the reason why the connection fails is because of the `sleep` intervals, and if that's the case we would need to find a different way to wait for the status change.


--------------------------------


```

  File "/home/travis/build/biocore/qiita/qiita_core/testing.py", line 42, in wait_for_prep_information_job

  File "/home/travis/build/biocore/qiita/qiita_core/testing.py", line 60, in wait_for_processing_job
    while job.status not in ('success', 'error'):
  File "/home/travis/build/biocore/qiita/qiita_db/processing_job.py", line 286, in status
    return qdb.sql_connection.TRN.execute_fetchlast()
  File "/home/travis/build/biocore/qiita/qiita_db/sql_connection.py", line 510, in wrapper
    return func(self, *args, **kwargs)

Offending files:\nraw_sff: The number of provided files (22) doesn't match the number of run prefix values in the prep info (11): G8VUN4101.sff, G8VUN4102.sff, HKNXA0F02.sff, G9JO88H01.sff, HKAYD4H02.sff, G9JO88H02.sff, HKNXA0F01.sff, HEHQ1P302.sff, HKAYD4H01.sff, GG7DRJZ01.sff, GG7DRJZ02.sff, HEHQ1P301.sff, GI9GO2V01.sff, GI9GO2V02.sff, H7AT18E02.sff, GQ99BWZ01.sff, GQ99BWZ02.sff, H2CWED301.sff, H7AT18E01.sff, H2CWED302.sff, H68ZCFF02.sff, H68ZCFF01.sff`

ValueError: Some run_prefix values do not match your sample names:
```

This makes sense because my fastq file names have dashes in them
`T2--16-20`
and my sample_names have periods
`T2..16.20`
I made them different on purpose and was not expecting this error.

Does the `run_prefix` of each sample have to match the `sample_name`? There is no mention of this in the [documentation on run_prefix](https://qiita.ucsd.edu/static/doc/html/tutorials/prepare-information-files.html#required-fields-for-pre-processing-target-gene-data). If they have to match, why include `run_prefix` at all?

Thanks for helping me out.

title: col name sampleid should be forbidden
body:
if you add a column namd sampleid in a prep/sample info file, the system will work just fine but when you try to do an analysis, it will fail cause the QIIME mapping file will have 2 sampleid columns. 

There are two solutions:
1. don't allow sampleid as a column name
2. rename it, if present at the analysis stage.

My vote goes to 1.

title: Should any user with access to a study be able to share the study?
body: Currently, the only one who can share the study is the owner of the study. Do we want to keep it like that or whoever who has access to the study can share the study? As an example, Bob owns a study and she shares it with Alice. Now Alice want to give me access to such study. Should Alice be able to give access or should Alice contact Bob so he can share the study with me?

title: Changes suggested for update sample template

milestone.title: November 1st, 2017
milestone.description:
Schedule:

Code Freeze: Monday October 23rd 9AM
PR merged: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate deployment: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate testing deadline: Friday October 27th 3PM
Main system deployment: Wednesday November 1st 7AM

body:
The update/add functionality needs some work to improve use-ability.  (Not sure if this will be fixed by new working page GUI.)
Problems:
1.  If you add samples to a template there are different options: add only the new samples without changing anything in existing template; update existing template without adding new samples; if you need to do both of these because you notice problems with existing template (very common) you may have a horrible template that has duplicated samples, some of them prepended twice with study ID;
2.  If the last situation occurs there is no way to step back to the last acceptable version of the template - mentioned in another issue (1589).
3. I think documentation has to reflect these current problems or we need to fix.

title: errors when raw files have spaces in their name
body: If a prep template with spaces in it's name is uploaded, split libraries is going to fail. Not sure of the consequences of doing the same in a sample template.

title: The admin error pages, writes JS raw
body:
The page is writing all JS raw so the browser interprets it. 

How did we notice it?
`<meta http-equiv="refresh" content='0;URL=http://www.ebi.ac.uk/errors/failure.html'>`

title: Consider re-adding generate demux CLI
body: This functionality will be removed with the addition of the plugin infrastructure.

title: Template parsing errors can't handle unicode in headers
body: Many of the errors raised in parsing, including the non-unicode character check, print the column header as part of the error. In qiita pet, some of these errors are explicitly converted to string (see [here](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/master/qiita_pet/handlers/study_handlers/description_handlers.py#L222) as an example). This means that if the column headers have unicode characters, the system throws a secondary error trying to print the original error.

title: add study_alias in the delete popup
body:
I remember discussing this and having an open issue but can't find it ... so opening one.

It's confusing not to have the study_alias, what you need to write, on the study delete popup.

title: too large SQL?
body:
While trying to update the full AGP we hit an error due to the size of the SQL. Now, this could be seen as an issue from our side cause we are generating a large SQL or psycopg2 cause is the library that we use to connect and execute PgSQL queries. 

The error simply reports something that doesn't make sense, in this case a casting error, but if we limit the number of samples being updated/extended it works fine.

title: Errors while updating prep template

milestone.title: November 1st, 2017
milestone.description:
Schedule:

Code Freeze: Monday October 23rd 9AM
PR merged: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate deployment: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate testing deadline: Friday October 27th 3PM
Main system deployment: Wednesday November 1st 7AM

body:
While trying to update a prep template I realized that we do this with [two steps](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/master/qiita_pet/handlers/study_handlers/description_handlers.py#L432): extend, then update. This behavior causes 2 issues:
- [ ] When you extend a single column, for example instrument_model, you get a few warnings that are not accurate: 

```
qiita_db/metadata_template/util.py:141: QiitaDBWarning: Sample names were already prefixed with the study id.
  QiitaDBWarning)
qiita_db/metadata_template/base_metadata_template.py:575: QiitaDBWarning: Some functionality will be disabled due to missing columns:
    Demultiplexing with multiple input files disabled. If your raw data includes multiple raw input files, you will not be able to preprocess your raw data: primer, run_prefix, barcode;
    Demultiplexing disabled. You will not be able to preprocess your raw data: primer, barcode;
    EBI submission disabled: platform, library_construction_protocol, experiment_design_description, center_name, primer.
See the Templates tutorial for a description of these fields.
  QiitaDBWarning)
qiita_db/metadata_template/base_metadata_template.py:716: QiitaDBWarning: The following columns have been added to the existing template: instrument_model
  QiitaDBWarning)
```
- [ ] Then, my guess is that the extend did everything we need, the update doesn't do anything and brakes with:

```
ValueError: Error running SQL query:
Query: UPDATE qiita.prep_1060 AS t SET

                     FROM (VALUES )
                        AS c(sample_id, )
                     WHERE c.sample_id = t.sample_id

Arguments: []
Error: syntax error at or near "FROM"
LINE 3:                      FROM (VALUES )
                             ^
```

title: Add INSTRUMENT_MODEL as a constraint for EBI submission

title: If RawData is linking the linking RawData option should not be there
body:
Currently, if a raw data is linking and you open the page in another tab, you could link to another RawData via the GUI. We do not tested if it was actually possible but the option should not be there.

cc @jessicalmetcalf

title: recover from ipython workers loosing heartbeat
body:
Sometime, and we do not know exactly why, the ipython workers loose their heartbeat and ipython restarts them. 

Discussing with @josenavas we think the issue is that we only retrieve the objects of the workers at start up so if they die and restart we are submitting to dead jobs.

title: allow emperor to plot unique values

milestone.title: November 1st, 2017
milestone.description:
Schedule:

Code Freeze: Monday October 23rd 9AM
PR merged: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate deployment: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate testing deadline: Friday October 27th 3PM
Main system deployment: Wednesday November 1st 7AM

body:
The issue is that some datasets (for example: the infant time series) the most interesting field has unique values in all rows. However, this feature is blocked by emperor. I can see two (3?) options: (1) We could open completely via emperor, (2) as part of showing the [summary of the biom table](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/issues/1296) we allow the user to select which categories to color by (then overwriting the not to color by unique values, which is the default in emperor), or (3) both.

cc - @rob-knight and @RNAer

body: The analysis results page shouldn't be using IFrames, because the state of each individual visualization is lost after you change from taxonomic summaries to beta diversity or to alpha rarefaction.

title: The uploader is not respecting memory
body:
Given a recent process kill, the uploader is either:
- storing the chunks being uploaded in memory as opposed to disk
- has a memory leak

Both of those scenarios are unscalable. Fingers point at the uploader as:
- there was at least one active upload going on, and it corresponded to the last log entries from the webserver
- the webserver was "Killed"
- at approximately the time the webserver was killed (no timestamps, but guessing due to time of day), a python process was forcefully killed by the kernel oom-killer

These got added when we're logging 403 errors. The problem is if there is a problem with resumable, and returns a 403 error, the contents of the file is added to the logging table. This means that we are logging a CHUNK_SIZE (not sure how big is the chunk size) every 10ms...

title: Clean up naming in qiita click commands
body:
We talked about removing the underscores a while ago, so this is a followup to that. If you pass `name=foo` to a click command decorator, you can rename the call to whatever you want, regardless of the function name.
Example:

``` python
@click.command(name='foo')
...
def bar(thing):
    # does things
```

can be called as `foo --thing 1` despite the function being called bar.

title: Send lists to postgres properly

milestone.title: November 1st, 2017
milestone.description:
Schedule:

Code Freeze: Monday October 23rd 9AM
PR merged: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate deployment: Monday October 23rd 3PM
Release candidate testing deadline: Friday October 27th 3PM
Main system deployment: Wednesday November 1st 7AM

body:
Psycopg2 has a nice feature: it will pass lists as an SQL ARRAY object, but it will pass tuples as a simple list.

For example:
    some_list = [1, 2, 3]
    sql = “DELETE FROM foo WHERE bar IN %s”
    conn_handler.execute(sql, [tuple(some_list)])

The resulting SQL is:
    “DELETE FROM foo WHERE bar IN (1,2,3)”

This is super handy, as we’ve been doing unsafe list comprehensions to get around the list -> ARRAY issue (see [here](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/master/qiita_db/data.py#L1424) as an example). We should replace all these with proper tuple use.

title: gzipped sff files are not supported
body:
`process_sff.py` does support gzipped files, but we are computing incorrectly the output file name.

The offending line is this one: https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/master/qiita_ware/processing_pipeline.py#L321

The code in QIIME used for compute the output file name is this one:

``` python
        sff_fp = join(sff_dir, filename)
        base_filename = splitext(filename)[0]
        if filename.endswith('.gz'):
            base_filename = splitext(base_filename)[0]
        base_output_fp = join(output_dir, base_filename)
```

title: Add how to join and extract primers in per sample fastq files
body:
1. run multiple_join_paired_ends.py to stitch the reads.
2. run multiple_extract_barcodes.py to strip out the primers (in this case, you would use a parameter file with
   extract_barcodes:input_type barcode_paired_stitched
   extract_barcodes:bc1_len 17
   extract_barcodes:bc2_len 21
   The reads generated from this step will be used in step 3, the "barcodes" discarded.

More concrete, it will break the function `delete_study` from the `study_description.html` template, in [this](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/master/qiita_pet/templates/study_description.html#L313) confirm call.

We should scape those characters to avoid breaking the JavaScript. I'm not sure how to do it, so although I think it is probably an easy-fix I have not labeled it until we're sure that it is an easy fix.

title: Drop storage of # of samples promised/delivered
body:
Currently we are storing in the study table the numbers of samples promised and the number of samples delivered.

The new structure should be:
1. Store in the study table the number of samples initially discussed. Not required and nullable.
2. Look at the sample template to know the number of samples delivered
3. Look at the prep templates to know the number of samples in which sequence data is available
4. Look at the demux HDF5 file to get the number of samples that successfully preprocess.
5. Look at the biom file to get the number of samples that successfully processed.

We should first get 1, 2 and 3; and try to get 4 and 5 later. Note that 3, 4 and 5 are not just a simple counter as a single sample can appear in multiple prep templates, so we should be careful in not counting the same sample multiple times.

title: generating bad qiime mapping files
body:
In the past we allowed to have barcodesequence, barcode and BarcodeSequence in the mapping file and all of them were translated to BarcodeSequence when we created the qiime mapping files. Now we only accept barcode, which means that old studies that have barcodesequence do not have a valid BarcodeSequence column in the qiime mapping file. 

The solution is to update all prep templates but I believe this should be done via a patch. Perhaps something like: if the preptemplate has barcodesequence or BarcodeSequence and values are different than XXQIITAXX we should rename to barcode and then recreate the file prep template and qiime mapping file.

title: Multiple mapping files are available for a single prep
body:
See study 958's raw data tab. There are multiple buttons for downloading "QIIME mapping file", but it seems like there should only be one.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2574407/7816369/2ad488f8-038b-11e5-91b2-aa0aacc2c361.png)

I think:
1. When a new sample template is processed, all existing QIIME mapping files for that study should be regenerated
2. When a new prep template is processed, any existing mapping files that were generated from that prep template need to be regenerated.

title: Using regex rather than directly check for indices in the sql args
body: The previous implementation will fail with empty strings, and other issues can be found. The current implementation is more robust.

title: Fixes 1194
body:
Fixes #1194 

"taxon_id" and "scientific_name" are required columns by EBI.
The EBI submission code now requires them instead of allowing them to be nullable.

EBI submission was uploading all the samples in the sample template. It now filters the samples to only upload the samples that are in the prep template, which is the correct thing to do (the other samples in the prep template may get uploaded in another EBI submission - i.e. different PreprocessedData).

title: ebi submission fails if sample exists in sample template but not in prep template
body: If the sample template has extra samples than the prep template you want to submit the code fails without reporting any errors to the GUI.

title: Email validation is too strict
body:
Just saw this error on the server (actual email censored, but it contains undrescores):

```
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/qiita/.virtualenvs/qiita/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tornado/web.py", line 1141, in _when_complete
    callback()

  File "/home/qiita/.virtualenvs/qiita/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tornado/web.py", line 1162, in _execute_method
    self._when_complete(method(*self.path_args, **self.path_kwargs),

  File "/home/qiita/qiita_main/qiita_pet/handlers/auth_handlers.py", line 39, in post
    created = User.create(username, password, info)

  File "/home/qiita/qiita_main/qiita_db/user.py", line 196, in create
    raise IncorrectEmailError("Bad email given: %s" % email)

IncorrectEmailError: Bad email given: email_with_underscores@hotmail.com
```

This is because of [`User.validate_email`](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/master/qiita_db/user.py#L459-L487), which disallows underscores, even though they should be allowed.

Additionally, line 487

``` python
return True if match(pattern, email) is not None else False
```

can be simplified to

``` python
return match(pattern, email) is not None
```

title: User.verify_code throws exception when user does not exist
body:
[these lines](https://github.com/biocore/qiita/blob/master/qiita_db/user.py#L272-L275) select the verification code that's stored in the database for the user so that it can be compared with the verification code supplied by the user on a password reset or user creation. Line 275 assumes that the user exists and throws an exception if it does not; we are seeing this error on the server:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/qiita/.virtualenvs/qiita/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tornado/web.py", line 1141, in _when_complete
    callback()

  File "/home/qiita/.virtualenvs/qiita/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tornado/web.py", line 1162, in _execute_method
    self._when_complete(method(*self.path_args, **self.path_kwargs),

  File "/home/qiita/qiita_main/qiita_pet/handlers/auth_handlers.py", line 66, in get
    if User.verify_code(email, code, "create"):

  File "/home/qiita/qiita_main/qiita_db/user.py", line 275, in verify_code
    db_code = conn_handler.execute_fetchone(sql, (email,))[0]

TypeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '__getitem__'
```

We should check whether the `execute_fetchone` actually returned anything before trying to access index 0.

title: "Modify" button appears on sharing column for public studies
body:
This button should not be there if the study is public. Currently, if I try to change the sharing settings on a public study that I do not own, no changes are made to the database, no feedback is given to me as a user, and an error is logged (e.g., `ERROR: HTTP 403: Forbidden (User adam.robbinspianka@colorado.edu does not own study 1030`)

Also, IMHO, the only person that should be able share non-public (i.e., sandboxed, awaiting approval, or private) studies is the sole owner of the study.

title: missing FK in study_users and investigation_study
body: @josenavas noticed while reviewing https://github.com/biocore/qiita/pull/1068/files#r28648682 that we don't need to remove links to study_users and investigation_study table for a study to be deleted. This means that we do not have FK constrains on those tables.

title: Fix extend functionality
body:
Some background:

The extend functionality was first introduced to add new samples to a sample template. However, if there was a new column, that new column was also added to the database. The problem is that at the beginning of the function, the existing samples were filtered from the metadata template so the existing samples didn't get the values for the new column.

This PR includes:
- the bug described above is fixed in a way that now extend can be used to add new columns, new samples or both.
  - moving part of the extend functionality to the base class, in preparation for adding it to the prep template (it will be needed in the refactor).
- the tests of the extend function were quite limited (they just tested that the sample id was there). I created a bunch of new tests, so the functionality is better tested in all the possible paths the function can be executed.

title: Modify EBI code so that it does not upload empty files
body: These cause error messages to be thrown from EBI's end

title: qiita_env make and database name conflict
body:
I ran into a situation where a user named 'qiita' had a database named 'qiita' in a postgres server, and in my configuration file I had the the database setting set as `DATABASE = qiita`. When I tried to run `qiita_env make`, the command would fail saying something along the lines of 'database qiita already exists', so I decided to do `qiita_env drop`, however since this was a new system the command would fail saying that the "settings table" was not there.

After talking with @josenavas, the solution was to change the name of the database in the configuration file from `qiita` to :arrow_right:  `qiita_xxxxx` (though really any name would work).

The solution should be to either allow for the database to be dropped regardless of whether or not the settings table exists (which might be problematic), or to come up with a self-explanatory error message.

title: Qiita's cluster must have at least 2 workers
body: If you set it to use only 1 and try to submit a meta-analysis, the job will never change from Queued to Running.

title: Make use of the information MOI pushes on job completion
body: We are currently not using the information that workers push once the job completes, for example an exception that might be occurring. This has been known to mask errors and make debugging rather complicated.

title: Creating generate_files function
body:
There was a lot of code duplication across the sample/prep template classes to generate the files; and in case of the sample template, there was a bug, since the extend function was modifying the contents of the template but it was not re-generating the qiime mapping file. There is another bug on the extend function, but I'll fix it in a different PR.

That being said, I just created a new function to encapsulate all the files creation and I removed the duplicated code and substitute it for a call to the new function.

title: Removing add_category function
body:
Reasons for it's removal:
- It is not used anywhere in the code base
- It has a bug, it is not modifying the `study_columns` table.
- It is repetitive. The same functionality can be accomplished with the `extend` function.

title: Fix inconsistency on failure updating
body:
~~This PR depends on #1050, review and merge that one first.~~

Main motivation of the PR: the `update_category` function can leave the DB in an inconsistent state because the updates to the samples are done independently, so if one fails, the previous ones are already modified. By moving the `__setitem__` queries to a function that adds them to a queue, we can use that function in `update_category` to perform everything in a single transaction block.

Also, in a previous PR, @squirrelo commented that the way types in the error were checked was probably not correct (for some reason I received that notification from github today). I tested it and @squirrelo was right, so I fixed it here. It is less elegant, but at least is correct.

title: ./test_data_studies/commands.sh does not fully populate db
body: In #1039 we realized that the script is not fully populating the database. We need to have at least the `preprocessed_params` and `processed_params` tables populated, and hunt for any others that are not currently being populated.

title: Fix --insdc option in qiita load_preprocessed
body:
Currently it is a boolean option, it should really be a "choice" type, in general we need to:
- [ ] Set a patch to correct existing entries as `true` to `submitted` (where should we get the accession numbers from)?
- [ ] Change the option type so we dynamically retrieve the available options from the DB.
- [ ] Rename the option to reflect the type.

title: Removing the remove_category function
body:
I don't think the `remove_category` function is needed, so I'm removing it from the code base.

The reasons why I think this function should be removed:
- It is not used in any place in the code base
- It has a comment that says "This operation may invalidate another user's perspective on the table", but no checks o safe mechanism is put in place.
- It is buggy: it is dropping a column from the dynamic table, but is not updating the study-columns table.
- Leaves the filesystem in an inconsistent state: once the column is removed, the sample template file and the qiime mapping file is not being re-generated, so the files do not represent the data in the DB
- Before removing any column in the metadata templates, multiple checks has to be done (i.e. it has been used in an analysis).

Since it is clear that a lot of though has to be put in this function, I think it is safer to just remove it for now and put it back once the functionality is needed and we actually have a design for all the mechanisms to notify users once a template has been changed in this way. Note that IMOO, adding new columns is not a big deal, however, removing columns is another story.

This causes email programs not to make the link clickable.

title: <study id>.<sample id> in preprocessed and processed data
body:
When loading a sample/prep template, Qiita will prepend study identifiers at the beginning of every sample name (if these didn't already exist). We should perhaps be consistent and do the same thing when loading preprocessed and processed data using the command line utilities. Otherwise you have a high probability of ending up with useless data i.e. tables and sequences that don't have a match with your sample metadata.

Updating the biom files is not a problem [`update_ids`](http://biom-format.org/documentation/generated/biom.table.Table.update_ids.html#biom.table.Table.update_ids) will take care of this. However sequences are a different problem, so I'm tagging this as a question for the time-being and a bug that needs to be resolved.

At the very least the commands should verify that all samples names exist in the sample/prep templates these are being added to.

---

We may want to revisit the `<study id>.<sample id>` approach as @wasade brought up #1017 as a palpable and outstanding problem.

title: WebSockets will not work over HTTPS
body:
If the server is being accessed through HTTPS, anything that relies on WebSockets will fail silently and only show an error on the JavaScript command line. The most important feature that's unavailable when this happens is being able to submit jobs.

``` javascript
[blocked] The page at 'https://qiita.ibdmdb.org/analysis/wait/1' was loaded over HTTPS, but ran insecure content from 'ws://qiita.ibdmdb.org/moi-ws/': this content should also be loaded over HTTPS. moi.js:77
Uncaught SecurityError: Failed to construct 'WebSocket': An insecure WebSocket connection may not be initiated from a page loaded over HTTPS.
```

For more information, see [this issue in moi](https://github.com/biocore/mustached-octo-ironman/issues/16) and this [StackOverflow question](http://stackoverflow.com/q/25496039/379593).

title: sql_connection.py error reporting is misleading

qiita_env make --no-load-ontologies
qiita_env drop 
qiita webserver start
```

results in the error:

title: Buttons are trying to write checks they can't cash
body:
Several buttons in the study user interface are active even if clicking them will lead to an error. For an example go to the sample template section of a study with no uploaded files, and press `Process sample template` or `Add samples to study`, both will error in a non-descriptive way. The solution is to either disable the buttons or show an error message at the top indicating that you need to select a file from the drop-down menu.

This same problem will happen if no file is selected, but I think this problem cannot occur as an entry is always selected in this menu.

title: Edit study not working
body: Can't figure out if I'm doing something wrong, or whether this is a bug. If I create a new study and enter a pubmed ID, it shows up in the "view my studies" page and in the study overview page. If I then edit the study information, remove the pubmed ID, and then hit "Update Study," the pubmed ID is not actually removed. Note that if I simply _modify_ the pubmed ID (instead of changing it to the empty string), the changes _do_ take effect.

title: Don't assume data types for required columns
body: `load_template_to_dataframe` should not assume the data types of the required columns.

title: Permissions for results downloads
body:
This issue was identified by @antgonza (and possibly others), so please add comments if I describe this incorrectly.

Currently, analysis results are viewable by anyone that does a little bit of URL hacking, even if they should not have access to the analysis.

title: shared status shouldn't be by study but by processed data
body:
This issue was initially discussed in https://github.com/biocore/qiita/pull/850 but we realized that this will require bigger modifications to actually work well.

Description:
Let's imagine that a study has 2 raw datas (A/B) and 2 prep templates (1/2) in each one (for clarity, we will have A1, A2, B1, and B2). Then the users makes public the study because A1 was published, then all the other raw datas + prep templates will also be public, which is not OK. What we will need to have is that the user makes public a process data, then all the files that generated that "biom" become public. We will display public studies based on their public process data.

title: If email verification code expires, user is stuck in limbo
body:
If you attempt to register and get to the stage where the system sends you a verification code via email, but then you do not verify your email address in the allotted time, you cannot proceed with the system. You cannot create a new user because the user technically already exists (and user_level = 5), and you cannot verify the email address because the verification code in the email has expired.

Possible solutions:
1) If the verification code expires and the user has not verified their email address, then remove the user from the system.
2) If someone tries to create a new user and the user already exists, but is unverified (user_level=5), then allow the creation of the user, and send a new verification code to the email address specified.

I vote for option 1. Thoughts?

title: QIIME sample id naming constraints are not enforced
body: Sample identifiers can include underscores and the system will not raise an error.

title: Searching studies with multiple datatypes can error
body: If you have a study with processed data of one data type (say 16S) and just raw data/preprocessed data  of another type (say ITS), searching for that study will give you an error. This comes from the fact that the study says it has ITS data, but it is not completely processed yet.

title: Sample selection error when selecting none
body: When selecting samples for a specific study, selecting none will uncheck study data type.

title: Error messages are being logged with a large number of characters
body:
There have been a few error messages showing up in the logging table that are so large that they cannot be displayed on the user interface and psql is having trouble printing this to the screen.

Try something like to see what I mean:

```
select time, length(msg) from logging order by time desc limit 50;
```

Do not try to get the full msg string, otherwise you will lock your psql session.

title: PNGs being saved to qiita user's home dir
body: Somehow, png files (which look like results of alpha rarefaction) are being saved into the qiita user's home directory (there are currently ~1500 files in the directory).  This might require a database data patch to fix, as some of the files might be associated to results in the DB.

title: failure on inserting new sample template due to wrong names
body:
If a sample template fails due to having incorrect column names, for example: a-x-b-x-b or aa_aa_0.4_aa_bla. The insertion stays in a inconsistent state that needs to empty qiita.study_sample_columns and qiita.required_sample_info.

This can be solved either by having a better parsing, doing transactions or both.

title: Raw_data are currently being placed in the same directory

milestone.title: Initial Live Release
milestone.description: This milestone keeps track of the minimal set of features, improvements, and bug fixes that are required before we release qiita to a wider audience.

body: This is not scalable. Files should be placed either in subdirectories by the study ID, or there should be flexibility to support N raw_data directories where N can grow over time. The central issue is the likelihood of this directory reaching 10,000 or more files is high, which begins to put undue strain on the filesystem.

title: unique constraint must be placed on tables that follow convention for convert_to/from_id

milestone.title: Initial Live Release
milestone.description: This milestone keeps track of the minimal set of features, improvements, and bug fixes that are required before we release qiita to a wider audience.

body: Currently, the `convert_to_id` and `convert_from_id` functions depend on there being a 1-to-1 relationship between the term and the ID being queried.  However, many of these tables do not have a unique constraint on the term (rather only having a primary key defined on the ID). This is a bug.

title: Better feedback on wrong params in test env

milestone.title: Confirmed issues or feature requests
milestone.description: These are known issues that haven't been assigned to a developer.

body:
The unit tests depend on data files that live in qiita_db/support_files/test_data, but if you change the BASE_DATA_DIR in your qiita config file, then it looks in the wrong place.

Tests should write out whatever files they need (and then subsequently remove them), rather than depending on files to be located in a particular location.

title: Ensure unique IDs for metaanalysis
body: ...in the case of the same samples run on multiple sequencing platforms, the resulting IDs need to remain unique.

title: auth handlers are still tailored for FORGE

milestone.title: Pre-alpha
milestone.description: Features and bugfixes we want done for the pre-alpha release

body: The URLs, messages, and structure of the code are still designed for FORGE (qiita_pet/handlers/auth_handlers.py).  @squirrelo, can you fix?

title: qiita_env drop_env should remove current files
body: We can add a parameter or not but it will be great to also remove the analysis, tables, etc files from the local installation.

title: search and mapping files should take prep info into account
body: Currently, mapping files generated from the database do not include prep information. Similarly, searches cannot be performed on prep data.  This is a fairly high-priority fix, but not required for the upcoming demo at ISME.

title: Job.create doesn't use passed options
body: The options need to be inserted into the DB by Job.create

title: auth/create does not work
body: `password` does not appear to actually get passed to `User.create` and appears to always be empty

title: Search over mixed integer/varchar fields
body: Currently the search engine does not take into account what datatype is stored in a column. Search will need to lookup the datatype as well as column names from `study_sample_columns` table and make sure the comparison can be done. For example: `pH > 4` currently fails because some studies have high, med, low for ph, not numbers.

title: Add to_file function to create a mapping file
body: Assigning to @josenavas

title: Handlers accept IDs via GET request, but do not check authentication
body: Right now people will be able to change the id in the URL to whatever they want and retrieve that analysis (or study, etc.), whether or not they are supposed to have access to it.  We need to add checks for permissions.

body: Right now we are using a literal.

When I clone from upstream/master the repo's size is 146 MB.

title: SQLConnectionHandler improvements

milestone.title: DB Interoperability
milestone.description: Implement all the classes needed to interact with the DB from Python.

body:
Two issues I've found:

1) There is no password passed to the init, so there is no way to give the user password for a database.

2) Would be nice to have the ability to return SQL query results as dictionaries using the DictCursor setup from psycopg2: http://initd.org/psycopg/docs/extras.html#dictionary-like-cursor

title: qiita_db/backends/sql/connections.py should be changed
body:
Currently this module will always execute this line:

``` python
postgres = connect(user='defaultuser', database='qiime_md', host='localhost')
```

This should be changed to only be executed if requested i. e. having something of the form:

``` python
class ConnectionManager(object):
     def getConnection():
        # here we should retrieve the credentials from a configuration file or something
        return connect(user='defaultuser', database='qiime_md', host='localhost')
```

body: We'll probably need to git rebase and rewrite the history, this will require to rewrite the history of everyone's repositories (git pull -f).
